title: Part A
stimulusHtml:

title: Part B

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

Note: The work for this part may be found in part (b). In that case, read part (b) for part (c).

First point: Considers both endpoints

Earns the first point by identifying x=− 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E5B@ and x=5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaI1aaaaa@3BDE@ as candidates in a table or in a written statement

Second point: Uses initial condition

Uses g ( − 4 )=7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4244@ in a calculation for g ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DFB@ or g ( 5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E00@

Third point: Answer with justification

The response must declare as an answer the maximum value of 10.5. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaGaaGimaiaac6cacaaI1aGaaiOlaaaa@3C94@

The ordered pair ( 5,   10.5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4353@ is not a declaration of the maximum value of g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadEgaaaa@3A08@ and does not earn the point.

If a Candidates Test is used for justification, all function values must be correct.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point: Confirm lim x→−2 ( g ′  ( x )+1 )=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B33@ and lim x→−2 ( x 2 −4 )=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4822@

Does not need to reference continuity or confirm g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgapaGbauaaaaa@3A23@ and g ′ ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgagaqbgaqbaaaa@3A1F@ are continuous at x=−2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CC8@

Earns the point:

· lim x→−2 ( g ′  ( x )+1 )=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B33@ and lim x→−2 ( x 2 −4 )=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4822@ [with or without limit notation]

· lim x→−2 g ′  ( x )+1 x 2 −4   → →   0 0   MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5544@

· lim x→−2 g ′  ( x )+1 x 2 −4 =indeterminate form  0 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@604F@

Does not earn the point in the presence of limit = 0 0 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C94@ i.e., lim x→−2 g ′  ( x )+1 x 2 −4 = 0 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4EBA@

Second point: Applies L’Hospital’s Rule

Earns the point for a ratio of the derivatives:

· lim x→−2 g ′  ( x ) 2x   MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4959@

· g ′ ′  ( −2 ) 2( −2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@435C@

· g ′  ( x ) 2x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4051@

Note: If there is an error in the derivative, the response will not earn the point.

Third point: Correct answer for limit

Eligibility: Earns the second point

Must be our answer − 1 8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BD4@ or equivalent

title: Part G
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

If the Product rule is not used, the response does not earn any points.

First point: Product rule

Applies product rule: h ′  ( x )=x ⋅  g ′  ( x )+g ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5122@

Product rule may appear as h ′  ( 2 )=2 ⋅  g ′  ( 2 )+g ( 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@501E@

If there is an error in the derivative, the response earns no points.

Second point: Correct Answer

Eligibility: Earns the first point

Must be our answer, h ′  ( 2 )=12 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40A6@ or equivalent
